key_decisions: Configure for Vite builder (faster than Webpack)
Create shared decorators for widget context mocking

1_executive_summary.purpose: Add Storybook 8 to the Business Dashboard monorepo for visually documenting and testing UI components and widgets. This enables component-driven development, visual regression testing, and serves as a living style guide.
1_executive_summary.value_proposition: Provides visual documentation for 20+ UI components and widgets, enables isolated component development, supports design system documentation, and facilitates visual testing workflows.
1_executive_summary.real_world_analogy: Like a component library showroom where developers and designers can browse, test, and document all UI building blocks in isolation before using them in the actual application.
1_executive_summary.use_case: Developer wants to see all Button variants → Opens Storybook → Views Button stories with all variants, sizes, and states → Copies code example → Uses in widget
1_executive_summary.output: Fully functional Storybook instance with stories for all UI components and widgets, integrated with Turborepo, accessible via npm run storybook command

2_risk_assessment.scope: 5 requirements: Storybook 8 setup, React 19 support, Turborepo integration, essential addons, widget context mocking
2_risk_assessment.file_system_risk: low (additive changes only, no modifications to existing components)
dependencies: Must work with existing Turborepo structure
performance_concerns: Storybook build time may be slower initially
Bundle size increase for Storybook dependencies (dev-only)
Hot reload performance in Storybook dev mode
security_considerations: Storybook is dev-only tool, no production security concerns
Ensure Storybook static builds are not deployed to production by accident
2_risk_assessment.breaking_changes: none (purely additive, no changes to existing code)

3_current_state_analysis.architecture_context: Monorepo structure with Turborepo. UI components in packages/ui use Radix UI + Tailwind. Widgets in packages/widgets use WidgetProvider context. Storybook will be scoped to packages/ui initially, with widget stories demonstrating context mocking patterns.

primary_features.description: Install and configure Storybook 8 in packages/ui with Vite builder for fast builds and React 19 support
acceptance_criteria: Storybook dev server starts without errors

primary_features.description: Configure Storybook to work with React 19, ensuring all components render correctly with new React features
acceptance_criteria: Storybook uses React 19 from peer dependencies
React 19 features (like useFormStatus) work if used

primary_features.description: Add Storybook tasks to Turborepo pipeline, ensuring it builds in correct order and can be run from root
acceptance_criteria: npm run storybook works from root

primary_features.description: Configure essential Storybook addons: Controls, Actions, Docs, A11y, Viewport for comprehensive component testing
acceptance_criteria: Controls addon works for all component props

primary_features.description: Create comprehensive stories for all 20 UI components (Button, Card, Input, Select, etc.) showcasing variants, sizes, and states
Create stories for widgets (ComingSoonCard, ThemeToggle) with proper WidgetProvider context mocking to demonstrate widget behavior
acceptance_criteria: Widget context (config, theme, capabilities) is mockable
Different widget configs can be tested

secondary_features.description: Configure Storybook to support light/dark theme switching to test components in both themes
acceptance_criteria: Components render properly in both themes

secondary_features.description: Auto-generate component documentation from stories using Storybook's Docs addon

edge_case_handling.setup: Widget story rendered without WidgetProvider decorator
